channel.title: Michael Smith News

item.title: Richard Marles has resigned as a parliamentary secretary before Tough Julia rang him up
item.description: Richard Marles, a Rudd supporter has resigned before Tough Julia rang him up.
item.content:encoded: Richard Marles, a Rudd supporter has resigned before Tough Julia rang him up.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: We're a happy team with Gillard, happy Simon, happy Kevin, happy Joel, happy, happy, happy.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: What else happened today while Gillard was Governing? The NBN company dropped its targets from 340K to 190K homes
item.description: One of the Gillard Government's reasons for being, is to free you from the shackles of the horrible internet and to deliver you the salvation of the NBN. The NBN Company this afternoon released its latest dismal forecast. Imagine choosing this afternoon to do that! This year's target of passing...
item.content:encoded:
One of the Gillard Government's reasons for being, is to free you from the shackles of the horrible internet and to deliver you the salvation of the NBN.

The NBN Company this afternoon released its latest dismal forecast.   Imagine choosing this afternoon to do that!

This year's target of passing 340,000 premises will be forecast down to 190,000, or maybe 220,000.

But don't take my word for it, here is the NBN media release.   Monopoly, no competitor, unlimited capital, buys out existing infrastructure from incumbent and still can't deliver.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: Tony Abbott holding a press conference right now
item.description: Tony Abbott is flanked by Warrent Truss from The Nationals and a lady, Julie Bishop. Tony said that Australia deserves better, we don't have to live like this. It's all about Gillard's self interest, not about the interests of the country. Minority government is an experiement that has failed. This...
item.content:encoded:
Tony Abbott is flanked by Warrent Truss from The Nationals and a lady, Julie Bishop.

Tony said that Australia deserves better, we don't have to live like this.   It's all about Gillard's self interest, not about the interests of the country.

Minority government is an experiement that has failed.  This parliament has outlived its usefulness.

Abbott has summed it up in one sentence, the Australian people must be wondering how long can this circus last?
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: Just another day in Gillard's paradise. Nett effect? The only grown-up to speak up today has lost his job.
item.description: Options open to Gillard today. 1. Listen to Simon Crean. Hear his argument. Modify her behaviour. Consider that Simon might be right. 2. Get rid of him.
item.content:encoded:
Options open to Gillard today.

1.    Listen to Simon Crean.   Hear his argument.  Modify her behaviour.   Consider that Simon might be right.

2.    Get rid of him.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: Rudd won't contest
item.description: Sauce: 4:49pm Kevin Rudd confirmed just prior to the caucus meeting that he will not contend the leadership ballot. They're now behind locked doors with One nominee (that we know of) for Leader and Simon Crean Challenging Wayne Swan for the Deputy Leadership. Will she claim to be "unanimously elected...
item.content:encoded:
Sauce: 4:49pm

Kevin Rudd confirmed just prior to the caucus meeting that he will not contend the leadership ballot.

They're now behind locked doors with One nominee (that we know of) for Leader and Simon Crean Challenging Wayne Swan for the Deputy Leadership.

Will she claim to be "unanimously elected unopposed" in true AWU spirit? or is there a challenger hiding in the ranks?

Update: (these guys move quickly) but yes, the claim was "unanimous".

Joel Fitzgibbon will consider his position as Chief Government Whip over the next 6 weeks.

 It's comforting to see some adults in the Labor Party speaking some common sense. 'Some' however is not the majority and the majority rules.

Peter Broelman says it all...
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith
